author: quezacoa
content:
Would there be any advantage in testing a rollback, e.g. to a pre merge block on one of the testnets that are being sunset? Maybe even more than one time? I guess different scenarios could be tested (merge fails amd we roll back pre merge, consensus bug post merge, ...)

Probably the test could not be finished till the merge so a failed merge scenario might be obsolete...

author: sky.cactus
content: I can't think of any situation where we would want to rollback.  I think the risk of rollback is just so much higher than moving forward in basically all scenarios.

author: sky.cactus
content: For starters, miners may not be available to mine at the necessary difficulty if they have all shutdown already.
